name: Michigan

processing_metadata.description: Official Michigan DMV processing rules and validation requirements

global_rules.code_system: Information needed - research plate type code system
global_rules.character_restrictions: Does not use letter 'O' on standard plates - only number zero '0'; Full rules: Uses the number zero 0 on personalized plates to represent both a number zero 0 or a letter O. Thus, if someone is issued personalized plate 70 FORD, the personalized plate will show the number 0 like this: 70 F0RD. The letter O is not used. A letter O is shown by using the number 0. Current, standa; Does not use the letter 'O'. The number zero '0' represents both a number zero '0' or a letter 'O'. The first character will ALWAYS be a numeric character. Michigan State University 'M' and 'S' must be keyed. Smaller letters 'M' and 'D' must be keyed. Example tags: MI-0KLH43, MI-MAA00A, MI-SAA00A, MI-105M540, MI-001D255, MI-00B99. OMIT EX POW (not keyed). DV: OMIT one of the 'DV', both are not keyed. OMIT ALL branch of service or campaign names.

stacked_characters.notes: INCLUDE: MSU 'M' (MI-MAA00A), MSU 'S' (MI-SAA00A), smaller 'M' (MI-105M540), smaller 'D' (MI-001D255). OMIT: 'EX POW', one 'DV' if both present. OMIT ALL branch of service or campaign names.; Extracted from 33 plate types with character modifications

notes: Michigan does not use the letter 'O' on standard plates. Only the number zero '0' is used to avoid confusion. Source: OOS.txt compilation - requires verification with official DMV documentation. Does not use letter 'O' on standard plates. Always use zero '0'.
main_font: Narrow sans serif, Highway Gothic derivative
main_logo: Outline of the state with a cherry or Great Lakes depiction
